featureDesc: You are a charming and witty person. You like to talk to people, and most people feel comfortable with you.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 bonus to all People Skills skill check roll results.

featureDesc: You are skilled at discovering new information.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 bonus to all Activity and Skill check rolls used to Gather Information.

featureDesc: You can read a dangerous situation and act quickly.
featureBenDesc: In the first round of an Encounter, if your Ticker Value is greater than any other participant (opponent or ally), you gain 1 extra partial action during this round.

featureDesc: By acting quickly, you can gain an advantage over your opponent.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, if you succeed at a Ranged or Melee Combat attack roll against a single opponent whose Current Ticker Value is greater than yours, you may exchange Ticker Values with this opponent.

featureDesc: You can catch an opponent off guard with a well-timed attack.
featureBenDesc: In the first round of an Encounter, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, you may reroll your Combat check for that round once if it was lower than the opponent's Combat check result. You may choose which result to use when Combat resolves.
featureNote: You may only use this Feature while engaged in Ranged or Melee attacks with a weapon that is no larger than Small Size.

featureDesc: You can cause an off guard opponent to become dazed.
featureBenDesc: In the first round of an Encounter, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, your successful Combat check roll against this opponent will cause the opponent to suffer a -1d4 penalty (rolled by you) to all subsequent rolls for a number of rounds equal to the penalty roll result.

featureDesc: While not wearing armor, your attacks are swift and subtle.
featureBenDesc: While you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather add +1 to your Ticker Value at the start of an Encounter. During your Turn each round if you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and your Ticker Value is greater than that of a chosen opponent, you gain a +1d4 bonus to all Melee combat rolls against this opponent.

featureDesc: While not wearing armor, you are better able to avoid being hit.
featureBenDesc: You can only wear Cloth or Light Leather to use this ability.  As a Partial Action you can attempt to avoid an attack.  You gain a 5% chance of avoiding any attack targeted at you by any opponent whose Current Ticker Value is less than yours during this round.

featureDesc: Your skills at gaining information have improved.
featureBenDesc: Your Take Notice bonus has increased from 1d4 to 1d6.

featureDesc: You can read a dangerous situation and gain the upper hand.
featureBenDesc: You now gain your Partial Action from Swift Action every round as long as your Ticker Value is greater than the Ticker Values for each of the other Encounter Participants during this round.

featureDesc: By acting quickly, you can gain an advantage over your opponent.
featureBenDesc: Once per opponent, if you succeed at a Ranged or Melee Combat attack roll against a single opponent whose Current Ticker Value is greater than yours, you may exchange Ticker Values with this opponent. You may only do this once for any given opponent within the Current Encounter.

featureDesc: You can catch each new opponent off guard with a well-timed attack.
featureBenDesc: In the first round that you engage in combat with any chosen opponent, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, you may reroll your Combat check once for that round if it was lower than the opponent's Combat check result. You may choose which result to use when Combat resolves.
featureNote: You may only use this Feature while engaged in Ranged or Melee attacks with a weapon that is no larger than Small Size.

featureDesc: Your first attack against any opponent may cause the opponent  to become dazed.
featureBenDesc: In the first round that you engage in combat with any chosen opponent, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, your successful Combat check roll against this opponent will cause the opponent to suffer a -1d6 penalty (rolled by you) to all subsequent rolls for a number of rounds equal to the penalty roll result.

featureDesc: While not wearing armor, your attacks are more swift and subtle.
featureBenDesc: While you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather you now add +2 to your Ticker Value at the start of an Encounter. During your Turn each round if you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and your Ticker Value is greater than that of a chosen opponent, you now gain a +1d6 bonus to all Melee combat rolls against this opponent.

featureDesc: You have improved your ability to avoid being hit.
featureBenDesc: You can only wear Cloth or Light Leather to use this ability.  As a Partial Action you can attempt to avoid an attack.  You now gain a 10% chance of avoiding any attack targeted at you by any opponent whose Current Ticker Value is less than yours during this round.

featureDesc: You are very good at uncovering secret information.
featureBenDesc: Your Take Notice bonus has increased from 1d6 to 1d8.

featureDesc: You are good at reading a dangerous situation to gain the upper hand.
featureBenDesc: The additional action that you gain from Improved Swift Action is now a Standard Action instead of a Partial Action.

featureDesc: By acting quickly, you can gain an advantage over your opponent.
featureBenDesc: Once per round, if you succeed at a Ranged or Melee Combat attack roll against a single opponent whose Current Ticker Value is greater than yours, you may exchange Ticker Values with this opponent. You may use this ability on any affected opponent more than once per Encounter.

featureDesc: You can catch an opponent off guard with a well-timed attack.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, you may reroll your Combat check once for that round if it was lower than the opponent's Combat check result. You may choose which result to use when Combat resolves.
featureNote: You may only use this Feature while engaged in Ranged or Melee attacks with a weapon that is no larger than Small Size.

featureDesc: Any attack against an opponent may cause the opponent to become dazed or unable to attack.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, your successful Combat check roll against this opponent may cause the opponent to suffer a -1d8 penalty (rolled by you) to all subsequent rolls for a number of rounds equal to the penalty roll result. If the opponent is already Stunned, then it may now only take Defense Actions for the same number of rounds. (no damage is dealt when the opponent succeeds at a Combat check roll).

featureDesc: While not wearing armor, your attacks are very swift and subtle.
featureBenDesc: While you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather you now add +3 to your Ticker Value at the start of an Encounter. During your Turn each round if you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and your Ticker Value is greater than that of a chosen opponent, you now gain a +1d8 bonus to all Melee combat rolls against this opponent.

featureDesc: You are good at avoiding attacks.
featureBenDesc: You can only wear Cloth or Light Leather to use this ability.  As a Partial Action you can attempt to avoid an attack.  You now gain a 15% chance of avoiding any attack targeted at you by any opponent whose Current Ticker Value is less than yours during this round.

featureDesc: You are master of uncovering hidden information.
featureBenDesc: Your Take Notice bonus has increased from 1d8 to 1d10.

featureDesc: You are excellent at reading a dangerous situation to gain the upper hand.
featureBenDesc: At the beginning of an Encounter, if your initial Ticker Value is greater than the Ticker Values of each other participant, you gain one free Full Round Action in which to act before the Encounter begins.

featureDesc: By acting quickly, you can gain an advantage over you opponents.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, if you succeed at any one Ranged or Melee Combat attack roll, you may increase your Current Ticker Value to be +1 greater than the Ticker Value of the opponent with the greatest Current Ticker Value during the current round.

featureDesc: You can attempt to do greater damage with a well-timed attack.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, you may reroll your Combat check once for that round even if your initial Combat check was successful. You may choose which result to use when Combat resolves.
featureNote: You may only use this Feature while engaged in Ranged or Melee attacks with a weapon that is no larger than Small Size.

featureDesc: Any attack against any opponent may cause the opponent  to become dazed and unable to attack.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, your successful Combat check roll against this opponent may cause the opponent to become  Dazed only able to take Defense Actions (no damage is dealt when the opponent succeeds at a Combat check roll) for 1d10 rounds.

featureDesc: While not wearing armor, your attacks are extremely swift and subtle.
featureBenDesc: While you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather you now add +4 to your Ticker Value at the start of an Encounter. During your Turn each round if you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and your Ticker Value is greater than that of a chosen opponent, you now gain a +1d10 bonus to all Melee combat rolls against this opponent.

featureDesc: You are very good at avoiding attacks.
featureBenDesc: You can only wear Cloth or Light Leather to use this ability.  As a Partial Action you can attempt to avoid an attack.  You now gain a 20% chance of avoiding any attack targeted at you by any opponent whose Current Ticker Value is less than yours during this round.

featureDesc: Your ability to uncover secrets is unrivaled.
featureBenDesc: Your Take Notice bonus has increased from 1d10 to 1d12.

featureDesc: Your ability to read a situation and take control is unrivaled.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Current Ticker Value is greater than the Ticker Values of each other participant, your Swift Action is now a Full Round Action.

featureDesc: By acting quickly, you can gain and keep the advantage over your opponents.
featureBenDesc: Each round that you succeed at a Ranged or Melee Combat check roll against an opponent, you may increase your Current Ticker Value to be +1 greater than the participant other than yourself who has the greatest Current Ticker Value during the current round.

featureDesc: You can attempt to do even greater damage with a well-timed attack.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value and your final Combat roll succeeds against this opponent , you may double all additional damage that would be dealt on the successful attack for this round.
featureNote: You may only use this Feature while engaged in Ranged or Melee attacks with a weapon that is no larger than Small Size.

featureDesc: Any attack against an opponent may cause the opponent to become dazed and unable to attack.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Ticker Value is greater than a single chosen opponent’s Ticker Value, your successful Combat check roll against this opponent may cause the opponent to become  Dazed and unable to take any actions for 1d12 rounds.

featureDesc: While not wearing armor, your attacks are incredibly swift and subtle.
featureBenDesc: While you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather you now add +5 to your Ticker Value at the start of an Encounter. During your Turn each round if you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and your Ticker Value is greater than that of a chosen opponent, you now gain a +1d12 bonus to all Melee combat rolls against this opponent.

featureDesc: You are excellent at avoiding attacks.
featureBenDesc: You can only wear Cloth or Light Leather to use this ability.  As a Partial Action you can attempt to avoid an attack.  You now gain a 25% chance of avoiding any attack targeted at you by any opponent whose Current Ticker Value is less than yours during this round.

featureDesc: You are skilled at entertaining people.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 bonus to all Perform skill Check roll results. Gain +1 to Reputation

featureDesc: You have experience at entertaining a crowd.
featureBenDesc: Your Entertainer bonus has increased from 1d4 to 1d6. Gain +1 to Reputation

featureDesc: You know what the crowd likes best.
featureBenDesc: Your Entertainer bonus has increased from 1d6 to 1d8. Gain +2 to Reputation

featureDesc: You are a master at keeping people entertained.
featureBenDesc: Your Entertainer bonus has increased from 1d8 to 1d10. Gain +2 to Reputation

featureDesc: You are one of the greatest entertainers of your generation
featureBenDesc: Your Entertainer bonus has increased from 1d10 to 1d12. Gain +3 to Reputation

featureDesc: Your People Skills have improved.
featureBenDesc: Your People Person bonus has increased from 1d4 to 1d6.

featureDesc: You are very good at dealing with people.
featureBenDesc: Your People Person bonus has increased from 1d6 to 1d8.

featureDesc: You are a master of dealing with people.
featureBenDesc: Your People Person bonus has increased from 1d8 to 1d10.

featureDesc: Your People skills are unrivaled.
featureBenDesc: Your People Person bonus has increased from 1d10 to 1d12.

featureDesc: You are full of passion and a little bit wild.  You aren't afraid to try new things.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 bonus to your Initiative roll result for Ticker Value.

featureDesc: Your free-wheeling attitude helps you to move more easily through life.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurous Spirit bonus to Initiative Ticker Value roll result increases from 1d4 to 1d6.

featureDesc: You are a true free spirit.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurous Spirit bonus to Initiative Ticker Value roll result increases from 1d6 to 1d8.

featureDesc: You are a master of going with the flow.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurous Spirit bonus to Initiative Ticker Value roll result increases from 1d8 to 1d10.

featureDesc: You are a Leaf on the Wind.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurous Spirit bonus to Initiative Ticker Value roll result increases from 1d10 to 1d12.

featureDesc: You live life moment to moment.  You act on impulse and can easily move from one action the next without much thought.
featureBenDesc: After the second round of an Encounter, if at the start of your Turn you decide to take an action that is different from the action that you took during your last Turn, gain a +1 bonus to all rolls that you make for this Turn.

featureDesc: When the odds against you are too much for comfort, you can make a quick exit.
featureBenDesc: If you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and remove yourself from active Combat during an Encounter and are pursued, you can move at 3x your Speed rating at a full run for the next 1d4+1 rounds instead of at the normal 2x Speed.

featureDesc: When the odds against you are too much for comfort, you can make a quick exit.
featureBenDesc: If you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather remove yourself from active Combat during an Encounter and are pursued, you can move at 3x your Speed rating at a full run for the next 1d6+2 rounds instead of at the normal 2x Speed.

featureDesc: When the odds against you are too much for comfort, you can make a quick exit.
featureBenDesc: If you are wearing only Cloth or Light Leather and remove yourself from active Combat during an Encounter and are pursued, you can move at 4x your Speed rating at a full run for the next 1d6+2 rounds instead of at the normal 2x Speed.

featureDesc: Your impulsive actions allow you to enter combat with unusual confidence.
featureBenDesc: If your Ticker Value is Greater than a chosen opponent in any given round, you gain a +1d4 bonus to your Combat Attack roll result against this opponent.  You will suffer an additional 1d4 points of damage from any successful Combat check roll made against you.

featureDesc: You are able to use an item at hand as an improvised shield to help prevent you from suffering combat damage.
featureBenDesc: As a Partial Action, you can grab an object within your Reach that matches your Size category or smaller and use this item as an improvised shield. The item provides a Block value equal to 5% per Size category.  For example, a standard (medium) Size chair counts for 3 Size categories and would provide a 15% Block to against any one attacker. The Partial action is required each round that you use your Improvised shield to allow for the fact that you are constantly having to position the object into the best position possible for a Block. Once the item has been used once successfully as a Block against a real Melee weapon, it is considered broken and will not be useable as a Block again.

featureDesc: You are able to use an item at hand as an improvised weapon to deal combat damage.
featureBenDesc: You may choose an object within your Reach that matches your Size category or smaller and use this object as an improvised weapon.  The weapon bonus for your improvised weapon is equal to +1 per item Size category of the weapon.  The item can be used as a Melee weapon or a Ranged weapon. If the item is used as a Ranged weapon, the item can only be thrown at an opponent within 30' on you.

featureDesc: You are quite impulsive. You easily change your mind.
featureBenDesc: Your Impulsive bonus increases to +2.

featureDesc: Your impulsive actions allow you to take chances while in Combat that may result in success.
featureBenDesc: If your Ticker Value is Greater than a chosen opponent in any given round, you gain a +1d6 bonus to your Combat Attack roll result against this opponent.  You will suffer an additional 1d6 points of damage from any successful Combat check roll made against you.

featureDesc: You are able to quickly dive behind larger objects for cover.
featureBenDesc: If you are only wearing Cloth or Light Leather and your Current Ticker Value is greater than your opponent's, you can attempt to move toward an object of your Size or larger and use that object for cover against attacks.  If you succeed at a Physical Action roll against a number equal to the distance in feet required to move to the object, you can reach the object without provoking an attack of opportunity and use the object as Cover against your attacker.  An object of your Size provides 50% cover. Objects larger than you provide cover equal to 50% + 10% per additional Size category. This Cover is only good so long as it remains directly between you and your attacker.

featureDesc: You are very impulsive and hard to control.
featureBenDesc: Your Impulsive bonus increases to +3.

featureDesc: Your impulsive combat style has made you a master of the unpredictable attack.
featureBenDesc: If your Ticker Value is Greater than a chosen opponent in any given round, you gain a +1d8 bonus to your Combat Attack roll result against this opponent.  You will suffer an additional 1d8 points of damage from any successful Combat check roll made against you.

featureDesc: You are very likely to act on a whim and you don't take direction very well.
featureBenDesc: Your Impulsive bonus increases to +4.

featureDesc: You fight by the seat of your pants and take every opportunity.
featureBenDesc: If your Ticker Value is Greater than a chosen opponent in any given round, you gain a +1d10 bonus to your Combat Attack roll result against this opponent.  You will suffer an additional 1d10 points of damage from any successful Combat check roll made against you.

featureDesc: You are extremely unpredictable and definitely uncontrollable.
featureBenDesc: Your Impulsive bonus increases to +5.

featureDesc: Your ability to ignore the risks and take chances in Combat allows you to be a dangerous opponent.
featureBenDesc: If your Ticker Value is Greater than a chosen opponent in any given round, you gain a +1d12 bonus to your Combat Attack roll result against this opponent.  You will suffer an additional 1d12 points of damage from any successful Combat check roll made against you.

featureDesc: You don't like to be cooped up in your room.  You like to get out and enjoy yourself while entertaining others.
featureBenDesc: If you have spent a day exploring and socializing in a settled community of some type, you gain a +1d4 bonus to all checks related to Personal Interaction that you attempt while in this location.

featureDesc: You are a social butterfly.
featureBenDesc: Your Sociable bonus has increased from 1d4 to 1d6.

featureDesc: You light up any room that you enter.
featureBenDesc: Your Sociable bonus has increased from 1d6 to 1d8.

featureDesc: You are the life of the party.
featureBenDesc: Your Sociable bonus has increased from 1d8 to 1d10.

featureDesc: You are the toast of the town.
featureBenDesc: Your Sociable bonus has increased from 1d10 to 1d12.

featureDesc: People like you and are sometimes willing to do a little extra for your benefit.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you receive a Favor, you have a 1 in 12 chance to receive one additional Favor.  Roll 1d12. If the result is a 12, you gain the additional Favor.

featureDesc: People like you quite a bit and are more willing to do a little extra for your benefit.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you receive a Favor, you now have a 1 in 10 chance to receive one additional Favor.  Roll 1d10. If the result is a 10, you gain the additional Favor.

featureDesc: People really like you and are generally willing to do a little extra for your benefit.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you receive a Favor, you now have a 1 in 8 chance to receive one additional Favor.  Roll 1d8. If the result is an 8, you gain the additional Favor.

featureDesc: People adore you and are mostly willing to do a little extra for your benefit.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you receive a Favor, you now have a 1 in 6 chance to receive one additional Favor.  Roll 1d6. If the result is a 6, you gain the additional Favor.

featureDesc: People adore you and usually want to help you.
featureBenDesc: Whenever you receive a Favor, you now have a 1 in 4 chance to receive one additional Favor.  Roll 1d4. If the result is a 4, you gain the additional Favor.

featureDesc: You are always in search of new experiences and outrageous encounters.  If you may even gain wealth, glory, and fame along the way.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 bonus to all non Combat Physical Action and Activity Checks.

featureDesc: Your experiences have made you more skilled at embracing new activities.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurer bonus increases from 1d4 to 1d6.

featureDesc: Adventure is your way of life.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurer bonus increases from 1d6 to 1d8. Add +1 to Reputation.

featureDesc: You are a master at embracing new experiences.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurer bonus increases from 1d8 to 1d10. Add +1 to Reputation.

featureDesc: You are one of the greatest adventurers of your time.
featureBenDesc: Your Adventurer bonus increases from 1d10 to 1d12. Add +2 to Reputation.

featureDesc: You want to travel to the farthest reaches of the world so that you can discover, explore, and document the strange and wonderful things that you will find.
featureBenDesc: Gain a +1d4 bonus to all Check rolls that involve Direction Sense, Geography, History, and Nature Lore.

featureDesc: You have become skilled at exploring new places.
featureBenDesc: Your Explorer bonus increases to from 1d4 to 1d6.

featureDesc: Your worldly experiences have made you a better explorer.
featureBenDesc: Your Explorer bonus increases to from 1d6 to 1d8. Add +1 to Reputation.

featureDesc: You have traveled far and wide and learned much about the world.
featureBenDesc: Your Explorer bonus increases to from 1d8 to 1d10. Add +1 to Reputation.

featureDesc: You are one of the greatest explorers of your generation.
featureBenDesc: Your Explorer bonus increases to from 1d10 to 1d12. Add +2 to Reputation.

featureDesc: For you, there is always a silver lining.  Even a bad situation can improve.  Lemons are only fodder for a cool refreshing drink.
featureBenDesc: If you fail on any non-Combat Check roll, you gain a +1d4 bonus on your next non-Combat Check roll attempt made within an hour.

featureDesc: You like to participate in any type of game or competition.
featureBenDesc: You gain a +1d4 bonus to all non-Combat skill check attempts used while participating in some type of game or competition.

featureDesc: You have improved your ability to compete.
featureBenDesc: Your Gamer bonus to competition has increased to 1d6.

featureDesc: You have advanced your ability to compete.
featureBenDesc: Your Gamer bonus to competition has increased to 1d8.

featureDesc: You are very good at competition.
featureBenDesc: Your Gamer bonus to competition has increased to 1d10.

featureDesc: You are an excellent competitor.
featureBenDesc: Your Gamer bonus to competition has increased to 1d12.

featureDesc: Maybe fortunes can change.
featureBenDesc: You may re-roll your Base Luck Value. Your newly rolled Value is now your Current Luck Value even if it is less than your original value.

featureDesc: You are a lucky person.
featureBenDesc: From now on, whenever you make a Luck roll, you no longer have to change your Current Luck to the new lower value.

featureDesc: That was a close one...
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, if you fail a Combat Check roll but your check result was an Even number, you may ignore all damage from this one attack.

featureDesc: You almost missed, but then you didn't...
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, if you fail a Combat Check roll but your check result was an Even number, your opponent suffers the amount of damage that would have otherwise been dealt to you.

featureDesc: Maybe this time...
featureBenDesc: Once during the Current Encounter, you may immediately re-roll the result of any one Die roll. You must accept the new value as your result.

featureDesc: You can't win if you don't try...
featureBenDesc: You may now immediately re-roll the result of any two Die rolls made during the Current Encounter.  You must accept the values as the new result.

featureDesc: I know this is it, I can feel it...
featureBenDesc: You may now immediately re-roll the result of any three Die rolls made during the Current Encounter.  You must accept the values as the new result.

featureDesc: Just one more time...
featureBenDesc: You may now immediately re-roll the result of any four Die rolls made during the Current Encounter.  You must accept the values as the new result.

featureDesc: Finally, I know this will do it for good and all...
featureBenDesc: You may now immediately re-roll the result of any five Die rolls made during the Current Encounter.  You must accept the values as the new result.

featureDesc: You are a free wheeling adventurer of the highest order.  You are always on the lookout for the next big adventure.  You are bold and showy.  You love attention and only do things in a big, loud way.
featureBenDesc: Once per day, you may substitute any one Check roll with a Luck roll.  If the roll succeeds then you have automatically succeeded with the Check roll at the maximum result that you could have possibly attained. If your Luck roll fails, your Check fails as if you had received the lowest possible result. Increase your Reputation by +1

featureDesc: You are a grand adventurer.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, you may substitute any one Check roll with a Luck roll.  If the roll succeeds then you have automatically succeeded with the Check roll at the maximum result that you could have possibly attained. If the Luck roll fails, your Check fails as if you had received the lowest possible result. Increase your Reputation by +1

featureDesc: Your exploits are sung from shore to shore.  Your tales are told at every port.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter, if a single Check roll result is Even, you automatically succeed at this Check even if you would have otherwise failed. If the result was Odd, your Check fails even though it would have otherwise succeeded. Increase your Reputation by +2.

featureDesc: Your exploits are sung from shore to shore.  Your tales are told at every port.
featureBenDesc: Once per round, if a single Check roll result is Even, you automatically succeed at this Check even if you would have otherwise failed.  If the result was Odd, your Check fails even though it would have otherwise succeeded. Increase your Reputation by +2.

featureDesc: You are a swashbuckling hero of legend!  Your adventures will thrill audiences for generations to come.
featureBenDesc: During your Turn each round, if your Current Ticker Value is an Even number and is greater than each other participant's Ticker Value, all of your first Check roll for this round is an automatic success as though you received the maximum possible result.  If your Current Ticker Value is less than any other participant and is an Odd number, your first Check roll each round will fail as though you received the lowest possible result.  Add +3 to your Reputation.
